Dear Ms. Edmon:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 “bear hugged” Youth A while attempting to restrain him and
caused him to fall to the ground.
Investigation The Complainant for the investigation was interviewed on
08/22/2024. No additional information was provided.
Youth B was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face
visit to the facility on 08/22/2024. He recalled seeing a part of the
incident in question as he was instructed by staff to go back inside
of his cottage. He recalled seeing Youth A standing out near the
sidewalk in between the cottages, speaking with Staff 1. Youth A
was yelling at Staff 1, and Youth B believed Staff 1 was not
responding. Youth B recalled seeing Youth A punch Staff 1 in the
face. Staff 1 did not react initially. Youth B stated Staff 1 then
punched Youth A back in the face, and the two individuals
wrestled to the ground. Youth B recalled seeing Youth A fighting
aggressively with Staff 1 at that point. Youth B did not see any
more of the interaction because Youth A and Staff 1 were across
a sidewalk and obscured by landscaping at this point. Youth B
also commented that he went back inside the cottage as staff had
been instructing him to do.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-
face visit to the facility on 08/22/2024. He stated he witnessed the
incident in question at the end of his shift for the night. He
recalled Youth A being escalated for much of the afternoon,
culminating in his walking away from the cottage and attempting to
AWOL, only to come back. Supervisor 1 recalled Staff 1 and
himself walking out of the cottage to greet Youth A. He believed
2

that any other youth were back inside either cottage at this point,
or shortly thereafter. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A being verbally
aggressive towards both of them, stating that he was going to
assault them. Supervisor 1 recalled Staff 1 approaching Youth A
closer and offering to talk more to him. Youth A then threatened
to punch Staff 1 if he did not back up. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth
A then following through and punching Staff 1 in the jaw. Staff 1
did not initially react to this from what Supervisor 1 recalled. Staff
1 then attempted to restrain Youth A when it appeared that Youth
A was going to punch him again. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A
attempting to move away from Staff 1 as Staff 1 attempted to go
hands on with him, resulting in both individuals falling to the
ground. Supervisor 1 stated he ran back inside to call for
assistance and then back out to assist in the restraint. Supervisor
1 commented he did not see the full restraint attempt by Staff 1.
Supervisor 1 recalled seeing Youth A on his side as Staff 1 was
attempting to hold Youth A’s arms, with Youth A fighting back
significantly. Supervisor 1 denied seeing Staff 1 hit or slam Youth
A into the ground. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A eventually
calming down when law enforcement arrived to take custody of
him.
Staff 2 was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face visit
to the facility on 08/22/2024. He recalled working in the cottage
next door to Youth A’s when the incident occurred. He stated he
was alerted to something going on outside because of commotion
he heard, and he went out. Staff 2 recalled instructing youth in his
cottage to stay put as he went to see what was occurring. Staff 2
recalled seeing Youth A arguing with Staff 1 and Supervisor 1. He
heard Youth A state “Get the fuck away from me” to them. Staff 2
heard Staff 1 state something to the effect of “Just talk to me” as
he was trying to verbally de-escalate Youth A. Staff 2
remembered seeing Youth A in a “fighting stance.” Staff 2
witnessed Youth A punch Staff 1 in the face, and Staff 1 took a
step back and did not respond immediately. He recalled hearing
Staff 1 state “Do you think that solved your problem?” to Youth A.
Staff 2 then heard Youth A yell at Staff 1 and it appeared that he
was going to hit Staff 1 again. Staff 1 then ducked and attempted
to grab Youth A by the waist, only for Youth A to pull away from
him causing both of them to fall to the ground. Staff 2 recalled
turning his attention back to the cottage where he originally was to
ensure all of the youth inside stayed inside. Staff 2 recalled
seeing Youth A on the ground on his side with Staff 1 attempting
to gain control of Youth A’s arms, but being unsuccessful in doing
so. Staff 2 did not believe Youth A was ever face down at any
point, but admitted to seeing the incident off and on from the front
3

of the other cottage. Staff 2 did recall Youth A being escalated for
several minutes until law enforcement arrived, at which point in
time he calmed down.
Youth A was interviewed over the phone from his new placement
on 08/28/2024. Youth A denied he ever punched any staff
members at the previous facility, and denied ever being
restrained. Youth A refused to provide any other information at
this time.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 08/28/2024. He
recalled coming out of a cottage to see Youth A coming back from
eloping across campus. Youth A approached Staff 1 and was
showing escalated and aggressive behavior, including yelling and
balling up his fists. Staff 1 recalled Youth A punching him in the
face. He described this as surprising because it came quickly,
despite Youth A’s escalated behavior. Staff 1 stated his hands
were down when this occurred, and he took a step back. He
recalled Youth A looking like he was going to punch again. Staff 1
stated he then reached to grab Youth A by the shoulders in an
attempt to prevent being hit again, and in doing so he felt like he
injured a muscle in his leg. Staff 1 recalled Youth A lunging away
from him and in doing so both individuals fell down. Youth A fell to
his side on the ground and proceeded to attempt to hit Staff 1
more, and Staff 1 attempted to restrain Youth A’s arms. Staff 1
believed another staff member came to his assistance after a
short period of time but could not recall who that was. Staff 1
recalled attempting to use a restraint hold trained for when youth
are on the ground and in a face up position, but this was not
successful because of Youth A’s struggle. Staff 1 clarified that
Youth A was never in a face down position. He also denied
hitting, “bear hugging” or slamming Youth A to the ground in any
way. Staff 1 never heard Youth A remark about being in pain or
not being able to breathe and stated that Youth A was loud and
yelling almost the entire incident.
Staff 3 was interviewed over the phone on 12/06/2024. He
recalled the incident in question because he believed Youth A had
AWOL’ed earlier that day and had then returned to campus. Staff
3 recalled Staff 1 attempting to call Youth A back to the cottage
while they both were outside. At that time Youth A was escalated
verbally and was yelling that he did not want to go inside the
cottage. Staff 3 witnessed Staff 1 attempt to verbally de-escalate
Youth A, and while Youth A was escalated Staff 1 remained calm.
Staff 3 was turning to go back inside the cottage to ensure the
youth inside stayed there, but then saw Youth A hit Staff 1 in the
4

face. Staff 3 was surprised that Staff 1 did not fall backwards
because the punch was delivered quickly. Staff 3 saw Staff 1 stay
still for a second and then attempt to restrain Youth A. Staff 3
remembered seeing Youth A lunge away from Staff 1 and both of
them falling to the ground. Staff 3 stated that he did not see the
rest of the interaction, but from what he did see Youth A was
never face down on the ground despite his significant struggling.
Attempts were made to contact Staff 4 on 11/18/2024 and
12/06/2024 and no return contact was made.
Video reviewed:
• Security video footage of the incident that occurred on
08/19/2024 was reviewed. In this footage Youth A and
Staff 1 could be seen a distance away from the entrance to
one of the cottages. While audio was not available for this
footage, Youth A could be seen yelling at Staff 1 and
gesturing wildly while Staff 1 was attempting to speak back
to him. The two individuals were standing approximately a
couple of feet apart when Youth A punched Staff 1 in the
face with his right hand. Staff 1 then took a step
backwards. Staff 1 then attempted to go hands on with
Youth A and in doing so appeared to trip forward, making
contact with Youth A’s mid-section. Youth A also took
several steps away from Staff 1. Both Youth A and Staff 1
then fell to the ground. The view of what occurred next was
obscured by landscaping. It was confirmed on 08/22/2024
that this was the only view of the incident.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report documentation dated 08/16/2024 and
authored by Staff 1 was provided and reviewed. Details in
this documentation were consistent with interviews
provided.
• Facility policy titled “Crisis Prevention Institution -
Nonviolent Crisis Intervention” last revised 09/01/2024 was
reviewed. This policy instructed staff to use the trained
restraint model as an intervention for specific reasons
including “physical aggression toward another person.”
• Facility policy titled “Physical Intervention” last revised
09/01/2024 was reviewed. This policy and procedure
provided staff with requirements to be followed during a
restraint, including never placing weight on a youth’s chest
or back and never hitting or kicking a youth.
5

• Training records for Staff 1 were provided. He last
participated in CPI training on 05/22/2024 and was up to
date.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per interviews with youth
and staff and documentation reviewed. There was no evidence
found that Staff 1 “bear hugged” Youth A or evidence that he was
the cause of he and Youth A falling to the ground.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition, medical
condition, psychiatric condition, and personal history, including
any history of trauma, and must be done in a manner
consistent with the youth’s treatment plan.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 attempted to restrain Youth A on his own without
participation of other staff.
Investigation Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 08/28/2024. In
recalling the incident in question, Staff 1 confirmed that he
attempted to restraint Youth A on his own. He stated he did so
out of concern that Youth A was going to attempt to hit him again
after the first punch.
Video reviewed:
• Security video footage of the incident that occurred on
08/19/2024 was reviewed. This footage was consistent
with interviews provided, in that it showed Youth A punch
Staff 1 in the face and Staff 1’s initial lack of reaction.
Youth A appeared to take an aggressive stance at that
point. Staff 1 then attempted to restraint Youth A on his
own, and both of the individuals then fell to the ground. No
other staff participated in this restraint.
6

Documents reviewed:
• Facility policy titled “Crisis Prevention Institution -
Nonviolent Crisis Intervention” last revised 09/01/2024 was
reviewed. This policy stated that “when single staffed, the
youth specialist cannot physically restrain a resident.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per interviews with
youth and staff and documentation reviewed. Staff 1 attempted to
restrain Youth A alone against facility policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
